gw.bc.accounting.entity

Interface Charge

  • All Superinterfaces:
    Bean, com.guidewire.commons.entity.BundleProvider, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.ChargeStubI, java.lang.Comparable<Bean>, Editable, EventAware, com.guidewire.pl.domain.messaging.gen.EventAwareStubI, IGosuObject, InCurrencySilo, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.InCurrencySiloStubI, InvoicingOverridable, com.guidewire.commons.entity.Keyable, KeyableBean, Reversible, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.ReversibleStubI, com.guidewire.commons.entity.Sourceable, Validatable, com.guidewire.pl.domain.validation.gen.ValidatableStubI, Versionable

    public interface Charge
extends InvoicingOverridable, com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.ChargeStubI
    Represents a charge on a policy. A charge is specific to the date that was used to calculate the charge.

        True if the charge has any kind of hold on it.

      • canBeHeld

        boolean canBeHeld(ChargeHoldStatus holdType)
        true if this charge can be held
        Parameters:
        holdType - The ChargeHoldStatus type to check if this Charge can be held for that type

      • updateHold

        void updateHold(boolean carryForwardExceptions)
        update hold information on charge
        Parameters:
        carryForwardExceptions - If true, exceptions will be carried forward

      • setHold

        void setHold(ChargeHoldStatus type,
           java.util.Date releaseDate,
           boolean carryForwardExceptions)
        All-in-one method to place a hold on a charge: calls setHoldReleaseDate(), setHeld(), and updateHold(). Checks canBeHeld() before doing anything -- if this charge cannot be held then this method will simply do nothing instead of throwing an exception.

        For agency bill, set carryForwardExceptions to true to carry forwards all exceptions associated with every invoice items of the charge

        Parameters:
        carryForwardExceptions - true to carry forwards agency bill exceptions

      • releaseHold

        void releaseHold()
        Clears the hold status and hold release date.

      • createInvoiceItem

        @Deprecated
InvoiceItem createInvoiceItem()
        Deprecated. 
        Creates an invoice item and adds it to the charge.
        Returns:
        invoice item

      • createBilledTransactions

        java.util.List<ChargeInvoicingTxn> createBilledTransactions()
        For each invoice item on this charge, create the billed transaction using InvoiceItem.onInvoiceBilled(). This method should be used in configuration code (pre-update rules, most likely) when a charge needs to be billed, in accounting terms, before the invoice that it is on is actually sent out. A likely scenario is when a large negative charge comes in, and that charge should "pay" future positive charges immediately. See CC-32911 and CC-33472 for background.

      • createDueTransactions

        java.util.List<ChargeDue> createDueTransactions()
        For each invoice item on this charge, create the due transaction using InvoiceItem.doDueTransaction(). This method should be used in configuration code (pre-update rules, most likely) when a charge needs to be made due, in accounting terms, before the invoice that it is on is actually due.
        Returns:
        list of ChargeDue transactions that were issued as a result of calling this method

      • overrideCommissionRate

        void overrideCommissionRate(PolicyRole policyRole,
                          java.math.BigDecimal newCommissionRate)
        Creates a CommissionAdjusted transaction with amount determined by the difference between the old and new commission rate. Also, updates the CommissionRateOverrides array with a CommissionRateOverride populated with policyRole and newCommissionRate, and updates associated agency bill payments.

        Note: calling this will override the commission rate on the charge regardless of the answer to ICommission.isCommissionable(gw.bc.commission.entity.CommissionSubPlan, Charge, gw.bc.account.typekey.PolicyRole)

        Parameters:
        policyRole - the PolicyRole of the PolicyCommission whose commission will be overridden
        newCommissionRate - the new commission rate for this charge

      • getChargeLevelCommissionRateOverride

        java.math.BigDecimal getChargeLevelCommissionRateOverride(PolicyRole policyRole)
        Parameters:
        policyRole - the PolicyRole of the rate of the CommissionRateOverride to return
        Returns:
        the charge-level overriding commission rate, else null

      • isAgencyBill

        boolean isAgencyBill()
        Returns:
        true if this charge's overriding payer is a Producer, or if the overriding payer is null, if the charge belongs to an agency bill policy period

      • isPaidByAccount

        boolean isPaidByAccount()
        Returns:
        true if this charge's overriding payer is an Account, or if the overriding payer is null and the charge belongs to a policy period with an Account default payer.

      • getTargetCommissionAmountForDefaultPrimaryProducer

        @Nonnull
MonetaryAmount getTargetCommissionAmountForDefaultPrimaryProducer()
        Calls getTargetCommissionAmountForDefaultProducerWithRole(gw.bc.account.typekey.PolicyRole) with PolicyRole Primary passed as the argument

      • getTargetCommissionAmountForDefaultProducerWithRole

        @Nonnull
MonetaryAmount getTargetCommissionAmountForDefaultProducerWithRole(PolicyRole policyRole)
        Gets the target commission amount (commission rate * total charge amount) for this charge, with the commission rate for a PolicyCommission with given PolicyRole. The PolicyCommission is obtained as follows:

        If there are NO ChargeCommissions associated with this Charge and PolicyRole, then the PolicyCommission is obtained by getting the PolicyCommission from the parent PolicyPeriod of this charge. (NOTE: Happens when a BillingInstruction like Issuance executes an InitialChargeTxn for a freshly minted charge)

        Once a PolicyCommission has been obtained, then this method delegates the computation of the target commission amount to that PolicyCommission.

        The PolicyCommission does have machinery to handle the case where a commission rate override exists at the PolicyCommission level and/or at the ChargeCommission level and will use the appropriate overridden amount.

        If no PolicyCommission was obtained on the Charge or its parent PolicyPeriod, then this method will just return zero.

        Returns:
        target commission amount for this charge, calculated via a policy producer code obtained as described above

      • getDefaultPayer

        InvoicePayer getDefaultPayer()
        Returns the payer used by default for the charge's invoice items.
        Specified by:
        getDefaultPayer in interface InvoicingOverridable
        Returns:
        the payer

      • isPolicyPeriodCharge

        boolean isPolicyPeriodCharge()
        Returns:
        true if this charge's t-account owner is a policy period

      • getPaymentPlan

        PaymentPlan getPaymentPlan()
        Returns:
        The charge's payment plan. This will be different from the policy period's payment plan if the charge was created with its own payment plan.

      • getPolicyPeriod

        PolicyPeriod getPolicyPeriod()
        Returns:
        The charge's policy period if the charge is a policy period charge. Otherwise returns null.

      • getEffectiveDate

        java.util.Date getEffectiveDate()
        The charge effective date is based on the billing instruction. If the billing instruction has a modification date, that is the effective date; otherwise if it is a policy period level charge it is the policy effective date. Otherwise it is the charge date.
        Returns:
        The charge effective date based on the billing instruction.
      • If the BillingInstruction has a modification date, that is the effective date
      • If it is a PolicyPeriod level Charge it, is the policy effective date
      • If it is neither of the above, it is the ChargeDate

      • getExpirationDate

        java.util.Date getExpirationDate()
        If the charge is a policy period level charge the expiration date is the policy expiration date. If the charge is account level then it is the charge date.
        Returns:
        The Charge's ExpirationDate
      • If it is a PolicyPeriod level Charge it, the ExpirationDate is the policy expiration date
      • If the charge is Account level, then it is the ChargeDate

      • getInvoiceStream

        InvoiceStream getInvoiceStream()
        Returns the invoice stream that is appropriate for holding invoices (which will hold invoice items) for this charge.
        Returns:
        an invoice stream appropriate for this charge. This will never be null.

      • setOverridingAccountPayer

        void setOverridingAccountPayer(Account newPayer)
        Account that is used instead of the charge's owner as the default payer for the charge's invoice items Makes the charge 'Direct Bill'
        Parameters:
        newPayer - The new payer to be default for the charge

      • setOverridingProducerPayer

        void setOverridingProducerPayer(Producer newPayer,
                              ProducerCode newCommissionReceiver,
                              @Nullable
                              InvoiceStream overridingInvoiceStream)
        Producer that is used instead of the charge's owner as the default payer for the charge's invoice items Overriding Primary Commission Receiver is required at this time as well, as Agency Bill Charges must be earning commission on a Producer Code on their paying Producer. Makes the charge 'Agency Bill'
        Parameters:
        newPayer - The new payer to be the default for the charge
        newCommissionReceiver - The new associated commission receiver for this Agency Bill Charge
        overridingInvoiceStream - the new associated invoice stream, if any

      • getDefaultPrimaryEarningProducerCode

        ProducerCode getDefaultPrimaryEarningProducerCode()
        Returns:
        the primary producer code earning by default on the charge for charges that are Agency Bill by default Returns null if this charge is Direct Bill, even if there is a default earning primary producer code

      • getAllCommissionRoles

        java.util.List<PolicyRole> getAllCommissionRoles()
        Returns:
        All roles for which this Charge is earning commission.

      • redistributeAllCommissionForPlannedItems

        void redistributeAllCommissionForPlannedItems()
        Re-does the commission distribution across all planned invoice items. Is called programmatically in beforeUpdate() when you change the amount on one of the invoice items on the charge. However, if you bind a charge and change item amounts before committing the bundle, that logic won't get called, and this method should be used explicitly.

      • redistributeAllCommission

        void redistributeAllCommission()
        Re-does the commission distribution across all invoice items. Is called programmatically in beforeUpdate() when you change the amount on one of the invoice items on the charge. However, if you bind a charge and change item amounts before committing the bundle, that logic won't get called, and this method should be used explicitly.

      • getOverridingInvoiceStream

        InvoiceStream getOverridingInvoiceStream()
        Description copied from interface: com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.ChargeStubI
        Gets the value of the OverridingInvoiceStream field. The overriding invoice stream for this charge.
        Specified by:
        getOverridingInvoiceStream in interface com.guidewire.bc.domain.accounting.gen.ChargeStubI
        Specified by:
        getOverridingInvoiceStream in interface InvoicingOverridable
        Returns:
        the charge's overriding invoice stream, if any. Invoice items for this charge will be placed in the overriding stream.
